de.systemagmbh.interfaces.config
Interface ISysConfig

All Superinterfaces:
ISysComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
CSysSourcelessConfig, DummyISysConfig
public interface ISysConfig
extends ISysComponent

An ISysConfig object holds a configuration tree and all informations necessary to load and save the configuration back to the place where it came from. Different implementations may handle different kinds of sources, e. g. INI files, XML files, other kinds of structured files, web servers or databases. So every implementation needs other values to access its datasource. Setting a new name must result in saving to a different location of the same type (e. g. another XML file for a XML implementation of ISysConfig).

Version:
$Revision: 1.12 $
Author:
Eugen Obermeier

Method Detail

init

public void init(Properties p,
                 String propsPrefix)
          throws CSysConfigIOException
This method initializes a configuration from the specified datasource with the specified parameters. What and how to load it is implementation specific. The necessary parameters come with the specified properties object. startPoint tells the config manager where to find the first configuration.

Parameters:
p - a properties object with all needed parameters
propsPrefix - prefix
Throws:
CSysConfigIOException - if configuration cannot be read.

reInit

public void reInit()
            throws CSysConfigIOException
Reinitialises the configuration from its source.

Throws:
CSysConfigIOException - if an I/O-Excepton occurs during reinitialisation

save

public void save()
          throws CSysConfigIOException
Stores the configuration.

Throws:
CSysConfigIOException - if configuration cannot be saved.

close

public void close()
Close all open resources (including memory) used by this configuration.

true if the specified Object is equal to this ISysConfig

clone

public Object clone()
             throws CloneNotSupportedException
Returns a copy of this configuration.

Returns:
a copy of this configuration.

merge

public ISysConfig merge(ISysConfig conf,
                        boolean append)
                 throws CSysConfigFormatException
Merge the the specified configuration to this configuration. This configuration keeps all informations about its datasource. Therefore save() will store the resulting configuration back to the datasource of this configuration.

Parameters:
conf - the configuration to merge to this configuration.
append - Sets the merge operation. If append = false children in this configuration with the same name and path like children in the specified configuration will be overwritten   by the children in the given configuration. Otherwise, if append = true; this configuration contains all children from the given configuration.
Returns:
the resulting configuration
Throws:
CSysConfigFormatException - if merging fails (e. g. a certain item is a parameter in A, but a section in B ==> a parameter can't contain sections)
